required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: Japanese Cather Ablation (J-AB) Registry is a voluntary nationwide registry, performed by Japanese Heart Rhythm Society, collaborated with the National Cerebral and Cardiovascular Center. The objectives of this registry are to observe and describe developments in the catheter ablation treatment of arrhythmia in Japan and to provide reliable information on the type of activity performed and the facilities available in Japanese arrhythmia units.

detailed_description.textblock:
Japanese Cather Ablation (J-AB) Registry is a nationwide, multicenter, observational registry, performed by Japanese Heart Rhythm Society, collaborated with National Cerebral and Cardiovascular Center.
This study is a voluntary nationwide registry and data are collected prospectively using a Research Electronic Data Capture (REDCap) system. Detailed data collection including antiarrhythmic medication is also performed at every September. The acute success rate at discharge and the complications associated with ablation procedure will be collected in all cases. Major bleeding events are defined according to Bleeding Academic Research Consortium criteria. Based on the provided information, the annual incidence and predictive factors for outcome will be investigated by the event assessment committee.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with recurrence of targeted arrhythmia
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through discharge from hospital, approximately up to 1 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through discharge from hospital, approximately up to 1 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: All-cause death, cardiovascular death, and procedure-related death

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with treatment-related complications
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding events, embolic events, other all complications. Major bleeding events are defined according to Bleeding Academic Research Consortium criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients treated with catheter ablation in Japan
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who refused to consent

overall_official.affiliation: The Jikei University School of Medicine

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Cardiovascular Medicine, National Cerebral and Cardiovascular Center
